intro: Cypholophus rufescens, commonly known as the red-brown scurfpea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its flowers are small and usually pink or purple, with a distinctive scent that attracts pollinators. The species is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
